metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12437 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
LibTomCrypt through 1.18.1 allows a memory-cache side-channel attack on ECDSA signatures, aka the Return Of the Hidden Number Problem or ROHNP. To discover an ECDSA key, the attacker needs access to either the local machine or a different virtual machine on the same physical host. It was discovered that LibTomCrypt incorrectly handled ECDSA signatures. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12437` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtomcrypt1 - 1.18.1-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libtomcrypt package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.1-1ubuntu0.1').
